If every tom dick and harry such as me could write, we    would have the sidney sheldons and the jk rowlings of the world peddling their wares in flea markets instead of sitting on millions of dollars, and putting the queen of england herself in the shade in the case of ms rowling. was reading Frankenstein by mary shelly, it has a section of text where Dr frankenstien's monster says that he/it came across a pile of books, that taught him about man and his ways, his likes his dislikes, and about love. such seems to be the power of the written word. On the matter of words as a form of control.. I feel that theres a grain of truth in the fact, that the written and spoken word can be used as a form of control, George Orwell in 1984 comes up with such an idea, and his reasoning that if we reduce the words that communicate emotions, one would eventually decimate emotions, similarly a vocabulary built solely on angst would end up vitiating the minds and breed hatred of the nth degree. if i dint know a word existed, how could i use it, and moreover if it dint exist how would i know what it meant?.. The obvious flaw is that emotions are not so easily destroyed, because a word alone does not convey emotion, it is a whole set of neurological impulses which culiminate in an emotion. still it is an interesting theory. Further discussion about words and images I have noticed over the years, that words can talk back to you, yes it is true, Take the word laugh, there is something in the way the letters are arranged that brings to mind a mouth opened wide in laughter, similarly with the word serious, the letters seem to remind me of a person with a serious face, similarly, the two oo's in gloomy merge with the letter m to create an atmosphere of gloom. I realised that this observation is not unique, i met at least two people who seem to feel the same. I have since, realised that this phenomenon is not singular to the english language, at least two other languages seem to exhibit this. however, scripted languages dont seem to. I m left wondering, is it the association of emotions with the words that causes this or is there something uncanny......

The wizard from hogwarts seems to have ogrewhelmed poor old Shrek, the fascination for the bespactacled teen which drives Young fans potty, is in itself rather fascinating. The average local kid May not know the name of his coloring book, but he knows Harry Potter and Co for sure. Though I tend to think of Ms Rowling Potter series as the kids version Of Tolkein's fantasy world, similarly peopled with dragons, and Other mythical creatures, as if she were trying to write lOtR In the guise of Enid blyton. She has rather cleverly interwoven The school stories of Ms blyton with the ethereal fantastic world Of middle earth. Of course credit is due to her since, a lot of others have tried to do a Similar exercise but have drawn blank.. also because she made the art of book reading cool again.. The film franchise, spawned by the book, has been rather surreal So far, described by certain critics as little more than effects amidst A story.. But this installment of cuaron seems to have captured some Of the potter magic..albeit a bit dreary atmosphere pervades the screen And some moments can scare the relatively young audience, however The slick effects and the magical music score as well as the cast Of kids who look perfectly natural given that they ve grown to be Teenagers themselves. Makes it an engaging spectacle.

Ever notice why anything of grave consequence happens mostly during the night,Nature's fury be it hurricanes, twisters,cyclones,earthquakes,tidal wavesOr accidents- on the road, in the air and on rails. What is it about darkness that Brings about mayhem.The theory about natural causes of disaster is that everything is amplified by a factor of 100 during the night.When a disaster strikes,Such as a flood or an avalanche, the feeling of helplessness is magnified manifold by our inability to see what is happening, so distress increases significantly leading to panic and death. Accidents on road rail and other wise can be explained away on the basis that in the night, the Level of alertness is suspect, and human error often leads to accidents, in addition the fear factor to use a cliched phrase is at its zenith.However nature seems to reserve its best for the night, lightning strikes,hurricane winds and earth quakes are recorded more often between the hours of 9 to 5 in the morning, and traditionally as is called at the witching hourâ€¦.
